body_html:
I've checked a list of properties of tuples here: http://www.tutorialspoint.com/python/python_tuples.htm

I picked out the ones that look relevant-ish:

print(a.shape[-1])
print(len(a.shape))
print(a.shape[1:])
print([n for n in a.shape])
print(2 in a.shape)
print((4, 8) + a.shape)

These all work as we'd expect, except for [1:], which returns a Size:

2
2
torch.Size([2])
[3, 2]
True
(4, 8, 3, 2)

I picked out the ones that look relevant-ish:
print(a.shape[-1])

print(a.shape[1:])

print((4, 8) + a.shape)

These all work as we'd expect, except for [1:], which returns a Size:
2

torch.Size([2])

True
(4, 8, 3, 2)
body:
I've checked a list of properties of tuples here: http://www.tutorialspoint.com/python/python_tuples.htm

I picked out the ones that look relevant-ish:
```
print(a.shape[-1])
print(len(a.shape))
print(a.shape[1:])
print([n for n in a.shape])
print(2 in a.shape)
print((4, 8) + a.shape)
```
These all work as we'd expect, except for `[1:]`, which returns a Size:
```
2
2
torch.Size([2])
[3, 2]
True
(4, 8, 3, 2)
```
